page.title: 03BEGUILDY C.IN W. SCHOOL
page.content: The present school was built in 1955 with three classrooms, a hall and a kitchen where the school meals are cooked. In 1977 a purpose-built nursery unit was added to the building. The children start school when they are four years old. When they are eleven years old they transfer to the John Beddoes Comprehensive School at Presteigne. Most of the children live outside the village so they have to travel to school by bus. Some of them live as much as ten miles from the school. All along the perimeter fence of the school are Japanese larch trees planted by pupils in 1958 to celebrate the Festival of Wales. Also in the school grounds are a swimming pool for learners and a wooden fort, built from logs for the children to play in.These were provided by Beguildy School P.T.A
